position.marginalia_text: Meris tandem apophthegmatis, et Mimis; gnomis, et prouerbijs; emblematis, et epigrammatis; stratagematis, et arcanis; salibus denique
iam, occupatiorq[ue] uacat Eudromus. Omnium fundamenta, artes, philosophia, professiones.
Earumq[ue] ipsarum vel neruosissimus Laconismus: vel saltem Atticismus
exquisitissimus. Strictus, et pressus valor. Nihil vanum, verbosum, aut vulgare: pra[e]ter prouerbia, et practica, non vulgariter accommodata.

marginalia.translation: Wiser and more engaged, Eudromus at last has time for genuine aphorisms and mimes; sayings and proverbs; emblems and epigrams; stratagems and secrets; and lastly, with witticisms and humor. The foundations of all things, the arts, philosophy, the professions. And either a most vigorous Laconism of these very things, or even a most exquisite Atticism. A tight and pressed valor. Nothing vain, verbose, or common: together with proverbs and practical things not prepared in a common manner.

position.marginalia_text: puncta inuentionis: spicula iudicij: elocutionis aculei.

marginalia.translation: The points of invention, the stings of judgment, the barbs of expression.

position.marginalia_text: Mente, ore, manu potens. In arcto acer: in paruo magnus.

marginalia.translation: Strong in mind, mouth and hand. Sharp in severe matters; great in small matters.

position.marginalia_text: Merus valor, vigor, lepor. Sed primus semper, et vltimus, valor. Vt mundus sentiat, Te Nosse, et Posse.

marginalia.translation: Genuine valor, vigor, charm. But first and foremost, valor. So that the world sees that you know yourself and that you are capable.

position.marginalia_text: Abiectus est, qui Se abijcit. Qui à Se non abijcitur, à nullo abijcitur.

marginalia.translation: Downcast is he who casts himself down. He who is not cast down from himself is cast down by nothing.

position.marginalia_text: Faxit Deus, vt magis Sim igneus Deus, quàm Vulcanus: magis aqueus Deus, quàm Neptunus.

marginalia.translation: May God make it so that I am more a fiery god than Vulcan, more a watery god than Neptune.

position.marginalia_text: Nihil externum, supra animu[m] viri. Nihil etiam, quod Corpori potest accidere. Animus, imperator.

marginalia.translation: Nothing on the outside is greater than the mind of man; nothing, even if something happen to the body. The mind is emperor.
